commit_message:
Add apache license to source files

As per OpenStack licensing guide lines [1]:

[H102 H103] Newly contributed Source Code should be licensed under
the Apache 2.0 license.

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: I84f948638594e7c8fe241e1c5cac7afe9fa1dded

commit_message:
Default pod subnet driver and os-vif utils

This patch adds a new driver type used to determine Neutron subnet
that should be used for Kubernetes pods' ports. This patch also
provides a default subnet driver implementation that uses a
subnet set in configuration file.

This patch also introduces the 'os_vif_util' module that contains
functions to translate data structures returned by Neutron client to
os-vif objects. Only the subnet-related functions are added in this
patch.

Change-Id: I643b22858239ce7f64e6ba81822b31e788fc9990
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/24/398324/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import mock from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import default_subnet from kuryr_kubernetes.tests import base as test_base from kuryr_kubernetes.tests.unit import kuryr_fixtures as k_fix class TestDefaultPodSubnetDriver(test_base.TestCase): @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers' '.default_subnet._get_subnet') @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.config.CONF') def test_get_subnets(self, m_cfg, m_get_subnet): subnet_id = mock.sentinel.subnet_id subnet = mock.sentinel.subnet pod = mock.sentinel.pod project_id = mock.sentinel.project_id m_cfg.neutron_defaults.pod_subnet = subnet_id m_get_subnet.return_value = subnet driver = default_subnet.DefaultPodSubnetDriver() subnets = driver.get_subnets(pod, project_id) self.assertEqual({subnet_id: subnet}, subnets) m_get_subnet.assert_called_once_with(subnet_id) class TestGetSubnet(test_base.TestCase): @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_network') @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.os_vif_util.neutron_to_osvif_subnet') def test_get_subnet(self, m_osv_subnet, m_osv_network): neutron = self.useFixture(k_fix.MockNeutronClient()).client subnet = mock.MagicMock() network = mock.MagicMock() subnet_id = mock.sentinel.subnet_id network_id = mock.sentinel.network_id neutron_subnet = {'network_id': network_id} neutron_network = mock.sentinel.neutron_network neutron.show_subnet.return_value = {'subnet': neutron_subnet} neutron.show_network.return_value = {'network': neutron_network} m_osv_subnet.return_value = subnet m_osv_network.return_value = network ret = default_subnet._get_subnet(subnet_id) self.assertEqual(network, ret) neutron.show_subnet.assert_called_once_with(subnet_id) neutron.show_network.assert_called_once_with(network_id) m_osv_subnet.assert_called_once_with(neutron_subnet) m_osv_network.assert_called_once_with(neutron_network) network.subnets.objects.append.assert_called_once_with(subnet)

Right now we have several scenarios that requires clean 9.0 installation

Change-Id: I0139a8321750db231ae9d79f876a8bbc2f03be5c
'}]
commit_message:
Use 4.4 kernel only for updated cluster

Right now we have several scenarios that requires clean 9.0 installation
but new code for 4.4 kernel is part of 9.2. Introduce new mechanism for
handling it.

Change-Id: I0139a8321750db231ae9d79f876a8bbc2f03be5c

commit_message:
[suse] Add hidden attr to password in the Heat Template

The password should be a secret, we can mark it as
hidden for that, see

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/template_guide/hot_spec.html#parameters-section

Change-Id: I05f018d128583e8933be06876b908c2864410a2e

commit_message:
Mark backup_swift_key option as secret

The backup_swift_key StrOpt needs to be marked secret to avoid it
from getting printed in the cinder log.

Change-Id: I6466aec5fa9001619c310bfb550851b13cc9719b
Closes-Bug: #1633623

commit_message:
Return 409 if removing/replacing image locations.

Currently image location updates (removing, replacing) are permitted for
images even if their state is not ``active``.
This lite-spec describes the need to prevent removal of image
locations of images that are not in ``active`` state and the replacement of
image locations of images that are not in ``active`` or ``queued`` state by
returning a Conflict Error (409 response code).

Change-Id: I6d984fcafa49ad806dce2bd56abcee66fdc77525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/92/368192/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Return 409 if removing/replacing the location of an image that's not ``active`` ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ :problem: When ``show_multiple_locations`` is activated, users currently can remove or replace locations to an image irrespective of the image status. :solution: Return Conflict Error (409 response code) if an attempt to remove or replace the image location is done when the status of the image is anything but ``active``. :impacts: A Conflict Error will be thrown preventing users from replacing or removing locations to images when the image status is not ``active``. :timeline: Expected to be merged within the newton-rc time frame. :link: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366995/ :assignee: Nikhil Komawar, Dharini Chandrasekar Return 409 if removing/replacing the location of an image that's not ``active`` +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

commit_message:
Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/98/396198/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $override_configuration = hiera_hash(configuration, {}) $override_configuration_options = hiera_hash(configuration_options, {}) override_resources {'override-resources': configuration => $override_configuration, options => $override_configuration_options, }
deleted_lines: $override_configuration = hiera_hash('configuration', {}) $override_values = values($override_configuration) if !empty($override_values) and has_key($override_values[0], 'data') { # Create resources of type 'override_resources'. These, in turn, # will either update existing resources in the catalog with new data, # or create these resources, if they do not actually exist. create_resources(override_resources, $override_configuration) } else { override_resources { 'neutron_sriov_agent_config': data => $override_configuration['neutron_sriov_agent_config'] } }

added_lines: def test_list_flavors(self): self.useFixture(keystoneauth_betamax.BetamaxFixture( cassette_name='test_list_flavors', cassette_library_dir=self.fixtures_directory, record=self.record_fixtures, serializer=PrettyJSONSerializer)) flavors = self.op_cloud.list_flavors() # check data type self.assertIsInstance(flavors, list) # there needs to be at least one element total = len(flavors) self.assertGreater(total, 0) # check flavor content is_valid = True needed_keys = {'name', 'ram', 'vcpus', 'id', 'is_public', 'disk'} for flavor in flavors: if not isinstance(flavor, Munch): is_valid = False break # check if flavor has the right content if not needed_keys.issubset(flavor.keys()): is_valid = False break # check that all flavors are public if not flavor['is_public']: is_valid = False break self.assertTrue(is_valid)
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(shade.OpenStackCloud, 'nova_client') def test_list_flavors(self, mock_nova): self.op_cloud.list_flavors() mock_nova.flavors.list.assert_called_once_with(is_public=None)

commit_message:
Update delete flavor test to work with betamax

Change-Id: If64a5fe7ad275ff92f48f0edff1e4d353cf7461b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/59/303459/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_flavor(self): self.useFixture(keystoneauth_betamax.BetamaxFixture( cassette_name='test_delete_flavor', cassette_library_dir=self.fixtures_directory, record=self.record_fixtures)) flavors = self.op_cloud.list_flavors() # delete first flavor found flavor_name = flavors[0]['name'] self.op_cloud.delete_flavor(flavor_name) # test that we have a one less flavor new_flavors = self.op_cloud.list_flavors() self.assertEquals(len(flavors) - len(new_flavors), 1) # test that new flavor is delete correctly found = False for flavor in new_flavors: if flavor['name'] == flavor_name: found = True break self.assertFalse(found)
deleted_lines: @mock.patch.object(shade.OpenStackCloud, '_compute_client') @mock.patch.object(shade.OpenStackCloud, 'nova_client') def test_delete_flavor(self, mock_nova, mock_compute): mock_response = mock.Mock() mock_response.json.return_value = dict(extra_specs=[]) mock_compute.get.return_value = mock_response mock_nova.flavors.list.return_value = [ fakes.FakeFlavor('123', 'lemon', 100) ] self.assertTrue(self.op_cloud.delete_flavor('lemon')) mock_nova.flavors.delete.assert_called_once_with(flavor='123')

commit_message:
Use byte string or utf8 depending on python version for wsgi

A recent change to the wsgi code broke deployments running over
httpd/mod_wsgi. This is because for py2.X mod_wsgi accepts byte
strings and breaks with utf8. However, for py3.X, utf8 is
accepted. So this acts accordingly.

Change-Id: I81739bc3de9d623b718987b5fc18eaf851533902
Closes-Bug: #1643511
(cherry picked from commit 11d8dde452b3ce52f77a637e1d6c98080bbd7fa2)

added_lines: if six.PY2: # In Py2.X Headers must be byte strings response.headers[hdr] = utils.utf8(val) else: # In Py3.X Headers must be utf-8 strings response.headers[hdr] = encodeutils.safe_decode( utils.utf8(val))
deleted_lines: # Headers must be utf-8 strings response.headers[hdr] = utils.utf8(val)

commit_message:
[PY3] byte/string conversions and enable PY3 test

* The dict.items()[0] will raise a TypeError in PY3,
  as dict.items() doesn't return a list any more in PY3
  but a view of list.
* Webob response body should be bytes not strings so used
  oslo_utils.encodeutils.safe_decode to decode it.

Partially implements blueprint: goal-python35
Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>

Change-Id: I38d416923bc0cec0ca98c4494dd1e06cd49671cf
(cherry picked from commit 0f152eb66153e16d4d8aba0f8afebaab046aea35)

commit_message:
DB API changes, Quota changes for the nova-manage quota_usage_refresh
command.

The patch implements the database API changes that will be
needed by the new nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command.

A new API is added to refresh the quota usages of the
selected resources.

Another API is added to get the PER_PROJECT_QUOTAS, which
will be needed later in the patch sequence.

Implements blueprint: refresh-quotas-usage

Change-Id: Id36328b2f2016eab2d7194b88d3eee8d016786d1
(cherry picked from commits 4a95c1c5ea4600f3068b021329101e891eb79158,
 c2dd3cd1adde130799339abd47d6fa380276d895,

subject: Make direct_client not override User-Agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-18 15:11:28.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_direct_client.py', 'swift/common/direct_client.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_reconstructor.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/e6ea33001e2bba04c73151757f0037e587add8cc', 'message': "Make direct_client not override User-Agent

Currently direct_client will always set the user agent in it's
request headers to be 'direct_client <PID>'.

This patch changes the behaviour so that if a User-Agent header is
included with the headers given to direct_client functions then
that User-Agent value will be preserved.

This is motivated by changing the replicator and reconstructor to use

Change-Id: I157df1397ff35a3e05e05a353b2f11df698e4acd
"}]
commit_message:
Make direct_client not override User-Agent

Currently direct_client will always set the user agent in it's
request headers to be 'direct_client <PID>'.

This patch changes the behaviour so that if a User-Agent header is
included with the headers given to direct_client functions then
that User-Agent value will be preserved.

This is motivated by changing the replicator and reconstructor to use
direct_client, allowing them to pass in their own User-Agent values.

Change-Id: I157df1397ff35a3e05e05a353b2f11df698e4acd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/34/399634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 09:33:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/tests/_base.py', 'neutron_lib/utils/helpers.py', 'neutron_lib/api/converters.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib/commit/95aca92aebc7fab7155f7e2c91fd7793c3f0ac25', 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I30a0a1dbee467e6ae1efd7bea5d0e3c745c59bbb
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I30a0a1dbee467e6ae1efd7bea5d0e3c745c59bbb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/35/400635/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return dict((x, list(y)) for x, y in kvp_map.items())
deleted_lines: return dict((x, list(y)) for x, y in six.iteritems(kvp_map))

commit_message:
Revert "Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin"

This reverts commit 8bf87a0b0593d0a26604678c5c3ee170f251aa83.

Becauase setting NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS unconditionally
interferes other subprojects.  (networking-midonet gate is
broken due to this.)

We can't hardcode the list of extensions here because a devstack
plugin can be used with other devstack plugins.  This stuff
actually belongs to gate, where we know our exact configuration,
thus the list of extensions.

Also, skip fwaas v2 tempest tests for now.
(Otherwise v1 tempest job would fail.)

Closes-Bug: #1643844
Change-Id: I300e1eee1314440c22e2b30b683969b83e84ea5f

commit_message:
Fix test_version_discovery test

Something changed in requests/urllib3 library and now it sends
requests with url in a lower-case. It affects test_version_discovery
test because we use url in camel-case.

This patch changes test url to lower-case to be compatible with old
and new behaviours.

Change-Id: I4ae9715b124adb0a2e0115c9b00ab16576665f72
Closes-Bug: #1643874

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage-specs refs/changes/23/400523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For backward compatibility, static data source will take over the control of the default configuration folder ``/etc/vitrage/static_datasource`` which was used by static physical datasource. Both legacy format and new format will be placed in the same folder. static datasource parse the file and check the existence of ``meta`` to decide which engine to use. If not found, proxy the job to static physical datasource and print a deprecation warning. Static physical datasource will be disabled by default and throws exception if running standalone.

subject: Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:17:36.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/ceeb5b948bdd69be141fed1c7f890263ea352833', 'message': "Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0

commit_message:
Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need
to switch it to http in order for it to work and for the services to properly
set the protocol in the links they serve.

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0
Closes-Bug: #1640126
(cherry picked from commit 255ea29cd425f096a22c000ecdc9e594cacdd36c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/86/400686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mode => 'http', mode => 'http', mode => 'http', mode => 'http',

commit_message:
[build][8.0] Implement hotfix flow

    Add builder part of hotfix flow for 7.0 release
    PROD: https://mirantis.jira.com/browse/PROD-8168

Change-Id: I3b24bdf4793ddcafb7ac00473cabfc88b5890b80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-mirror refs/changes/05/400705/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local DEB_BINARIES DEB_BINARIES=$(find "$TMP_DIR" -name *.deb | awk -F'/' '{print $NF}' | cut -d'_' -f1 | tr '\n' ',') DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME=${DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME:-$DEB_DIST_NAME} DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME=${DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME:-$DEB_DIST_NAME} DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME=${DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME:-$DEB_DIST_NAME} DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME=${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME:-$DEB_DIST_NAME} DEB_HOTFIX_DIST_NAME=${DEB_HOTFIX_DIST_NAME:-hotfix} DEB_UPDATES_COMPONENT=${DEB_UPDATES_COMPONENT:-$DEB_COMPONENT} DEB_PROPOSED_COMPONENT=${DEB_PROPOSED_COMPONENT:-$DEB_COMPONENT} DEB_SECURITY_COMPONENT=${DEB_SECURITY_COMPONENT:-$DEB_COMPONENT} DEB_HOLDBACK_COMPONENT=${DEB_HOLDBACK_COMPONENT:-$DEB_COMPONENT} DEB_HOTFIX_COMPONENT=${DEB_HOTFIX_COMPONENT:-$DEB_COMPONENT} local LOCAL_REPO_PATH=${REPO_BASE_PATH}/${DEB_REPO_PATH} local DBDIR="+b/db" local CONFIGDIR="${LOCAL_REPO_PATH}/conf" local DISTDIR="${LOCAL_REPO_PATH}/public/dists/" local OUTDIR="+b/public/" if [ ! -d "${CONFIGDIR}" ] ; then mkdir -p ${CONFIGDIR} job_lock ${CONFIGDIR}.lock wait 3600 for dist_name in ${DEB_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME} \ ${DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME} \ ${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_HOTFIX_DIST_NAME} ; do cat >> ${CONFIGDIR}/distributions <<- EOF Origin: ${ORIGIN} Label: ${DEB_DIST_NAME} Suite: ${dist_name} Codename: ${dist_name} Version: ${PRODUCT_VERSION} Architectures: amd64 i386 source Components: main restricted UDebComponents: main restricted Contents: . .gz .bz2 EOF reprepro --basedir ${LOCAL_REPO_PATH} --dbdir ${DBDIR} \ --outdir ${OUTDIR} --distdir ${DISTDIR} --confdir ${CONFIGDIR} \ export ${dist_name} # Fix Codename field local release_file="${DISTDIR}/${dist_name}/Release" sed "s|^Codename:.*$|Codename: ${DEB_DIST_NAME}|" \ -i ${release_file} rm -f ${release_file}.gpg # ReSign Release file [ -n "${SIGN_STRING}" ] \ && gpg --sign --local-user ${SIGKEYID} -ba \ -o ${release_file}.gpg ${release_file} done job_lock ${CONFIGDIR}.lock unset fi if [ "${IS_HOTFIX}" = 'true' ] ; then DEB_DIST_NAME=${DEB_HOTFIX_DIST_NAME} DEB_COMPONENT=${DEB_HOTFIX_COMPONENT} fi ${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_HOTFIX_DIST_NAME}; do local _inrelease_file=${DISTDIR}/${dist_name}/InRelease gpg --sign --local-user "$SIGKEYID" --clearsign -o "$_inrelease_file" "$_release_file" local inrelease_file="${DISTDIR}/${DEB_DIST_NAME}/InRelease" rm -f "${release_file}.gpg" "$inrelease_file" gpg --sign --local-user "$SIGKEYID" -ba -o "${release_file}.gpg" "${release_file}" gpg --sign --local-user "$SIGKEYID" --clearsign -o "$inrelease_file" "$release_file" gpg -o "${pub_key_file}.tmp" --armor --export "$SIGKEYID" DEB_BINARIES=$DEB_BINARIES
deleted_lines: for repo_path in ${DEB_REPO_PATH} ; do local LOCAL_REPO_PATH=${REPO_BASE_PATH}/${repo_path} local DBDIR="+b/db" local CONFIGDIR="${LOCAL_REPO_PATH}/conf" local DISTDIR="${LOCAL_REPO_PATH}/public/dists/" local OUTDIR="+b/public/" if [ ! -d "${CONFIGDIR}" ] ; then mkdir -p ${CONFIGDIR} job_lock ${CONFIGDIR}.lock wait 3600 for dist_name in ${DEB_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME} \ ${DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME} ${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME} ; do cat >> ${CONFIGDIR}/distributions <<- EOF Origin: ${ORIGIN} Label: ${DEB_DIST_NAME} Suite: ${dist_name} Codename: ${dist_name} Version: ${PRODUCT_VERSION} Architectures: amd64 i386 source Components: main restricted UDebComponents: main restricted Contents: . .gz .bz2 EOF reprepro --basedir ${LOCAL_REPO_PATH} --dbdir ${DBDIR} \ --outdir ${OUTDIR} --distdir ${DISTDIR} --confdir ${CONFIGDIR} \ export ${dist_name} # Fix Codename field local release_file="${DISTDIR}/${dist_name}/Release" sed "s|^Codename:.*$|Codename: ${DEB_DIST_NAME}|" \ -i ${release_file} rm -f ${release_file}.gpg # ReSign Release file [ -n "${SIGN_STRING}" ] \ && gpg --sign --local-user ${SIGKEYID} -ba \ -o ${release_file}.gpg ${release_file} done job_lock ${CONFIGDIR}.lock unset fi done [ -z "${DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME}" ] && DEB_UPDATES_DIST_NAME=${DEB_DIST_NAME} [ -z "${DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME}" ] && DEB_PROPOSED_DIST_NAME=${DEB_DIST_NAME} [ -z "${DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME}" ] && DEB_SECURITY_DIST_NAME=${DEB_DIST_NAME} [ -z "${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME}" ] && DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME=${DEB_DIST_NAME} [ -z "${DEB_UPDATES_COMPONENT}" ] && DEB_UPDATES_COMPONENT=${DEB_COMPONENT} [ -z "${DEB_PROPOSED_COMPONENT}" ] && DEB_PROPOSED_COMPONENT=${DEB_COMPONENT} [ -z "${DEB_SECURITY_COMPONENT}" ] && DEB_SECURITY_COMPONENT=${DEB_COMPONENT} [ -z "${DEB_HOLDBACK_COMPONENT}" ] && DEB_HOLDBACK_COMPONENT=${DEB_COMPONENT} ${DEB_HOLDBACK_DIST_NAME} ; do rm -f ${release_file}.gpg gpg --sign --local-user ${SIGKEYID} -ba -o ${release_file}.gpg ${release_file} gpg -o ${pub_key_file}.tmp --armor --export ${SIGKEYID} DEB_BINARIES=$(cat ${BINSRCLIST} | grep ^Binary | sed 's|^Binary:||; s| ||g')

commit_message:
Disable HA for RPC queues by default

RPC wihout HA was tested on a big scale and we found that it greatly
reduces load OpenStack puts on RabbitMQ. Hence it is valuable to
disable it by default.

Change-Id: Iffa4173c2e6bb54e411defc7bdc44254669be5fd
Closes-Bug: #1550303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/64/277964/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $enable_rpc_ha = hiera('enable_rpc_ha', 'false')
deleted_lines: $enable_rpc_ha = hiera('enable_rpc_ha', 'true')

commit_message:
Handle security_groups setting

Set openvswitch firewall driver explicitly in dpdk case
on compute nodes otherwise get it from source of hiera.

Implements: blueprint security-groups-support-for-ovs
Change-Id: Ia4f927c6f4743d7f42bf3a0352295b97c9b56d3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/72/400272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: firewall_driver => hiera('security_groups', 'iptables_hybrid'),
deleted_lines: firewall_driver => 'neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver',

commit_message:
Add gate-quickstart role

This role lets arbitrary tripleo-quickstart and
tripleo-quickstart-extras changes be gated together through the
"Depends-On" mechanism.

Change-Id: If5b747b1bba17dd20efa9e7caee6fbc638dbb716
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/48/397748/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- # This playbooks is responsible for gating changes in tripleo-quickstart or # tripleo-quickstart-extras with a possibility to depend on changes from the # other repo - name: Gate quickstart changes hosts: localhost roles: - gate-quickstart

commit_message:
create a horizon plugin

Move vitragedashboard to vitrage-dashboard/dashboard
vitragealarms to vitrage-dashboard/alarms
vitragetemplates to vitrage-dashboard/templates
etc.

Enable to use this as horizon plugin without the need of
copying over API files, simply place files from enabled
directory in horizons openstack_dashboard/local/enabled
folder.

Change-Id: I38ea4e32abbad75e5432b8c1dfe64511162a7248

commit_message:
Use "cinder_api" as the backend name

"cinder_api" is used instead of "cinder-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: I09e484fc7a94852b62946928f22e7220597f5599

commit_message:
Use "nova_api" as the backend name

And similarly for nova-metadata-api and nova-novncproxy-websocket.

"nova_api" is used instead of "nova-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: Id4d6fb6788fedeb9cc15eddfe59a0ad4ddc32699

Use "keystone_public_api" as the backend name

And similarly for keystone-admin-api.

"keystone_public_api" is used instead of "keystone-public-api" as the
backend name in the haproxy configuration. Ideally, we should not rely
on names defined in the user configuration, but we have no solution for
this right now.

commit_message:
Use "heat_api" as the backend name

And similarly for heat-cfn-api.

"heat_api" is used instead of "heat-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: If7c61bec66d49e6a763892be7c6a68799e700402

Use "neutron_api" as the backend name

"neutron_api" is used instead of "neutron-api" as the backend name in the
haproxy configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: I55be0555f04b820b1a2dec3cd453632db0bdcd9d

commit_message:
Remove cmd from logging exception template

With current approach logging exceptions fails with KeyError if command
itself has curly braces. E.g. awk '{print $2}'.
We need to avoid such situations, since logging exceptions is crucial
for debugging.

+ Do not format template string with command in it, use concatenation instead
+ Add negative unittest for such case

Change-Id: I0570b9fe24e662b0542f6402a0a7a882508abc8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/27/398927/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: "'{cmd}' stdout is not valid {fmt}:\n" cmd=self.cmd, logger.exception(tmpl.format(stdout=self.stdout_str))

commit_message:
Reconnect to libvirt service if previous connection is lost

re-trying a requiest doesn't help in cases when chached connection
was closed.

- do not cache the connection in a property
- check conn.isAlive() each time when already existing connection
  is picked

Closes-Bug:#1639788
Change-Id: I23c65162e32c97a03fc2950c41d13b83f350fee2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/76/393776/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if connection_string in self.connections: if conn.isAlive(): # Use a cached connection only if it is alive return conn else: logger.error("Connection to libvirt '{0}' is broken, create a" " new connection".format(connection_string)) # Create a new connection conn = libvirt.open(connection_string) self.connections[connection_string] = conn @property
deleted_lines: if connection_string not in self.connections: conn = libvirt.open(connection_string) self.connections[connection_string] = conn else: @functional.cached_property

commit_message:
Retry requrest to libvirt in case of libvirt errors

- retry request to libvirt in cases when libvirt close connection
- suspend environment before snapshot by default
- resume environment after revert by default

Change-Id: Ib11764ce712b1e9ffa59c71fa569463385cdf4e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/41/392141/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def snapshot(self, name=None, description=None, force=False, suspend=True): """Snapshot the environment :param name: name of the snapshot. Current timestamp, if name is None :param description: any string that will be placed to the 'description' section in the snapshot XML :param force: If True - overwrite the existing snapshot. Default: False :param suspend: suspend environment before snapshot if True (default) """ if suspend: for nod in self.get_nodes(): nod.suspend() def revert(self, name=None, flag=True, resume=True): """Revert the environment from snapshot :param name: name of the snapshot :param flag: raise Exception if True (default) and snapshot not found :param resume: resume environment after revert if True (default) """ if resume: for nod in self.get_nodes(): nod.resume(name)
deleted_lines: def snapshot(self, name=None, description=None, force=False): def revert(self, name=None, flag=True):

commit_message:
Data migration for the firewall driver switch

* data migration was prepared

(cherry picked from commit ec9ccd02d4a468e41f59eee4ed60c1a28cad98f8)

added_lines: from distutils import version as versfrom nailgun.utils import get_environment_version def is_security_group_available(release_version, compare_version): env_version = get_environment_version(release_version) return vers.StrictVersion(env_version) >= vers.StrictVersion( compare_version)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 20:31:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/abcd9dd2c52af60c4e94364573d576f04ef70efd', 'message': "Add missing volume clone & snapshot skips

The following patch [1] that disables volume snapshots and clones fails
with a number of clone NotImplementedErrors, and one AttributeError:

error case.

commit_message:
Add missing volume snapshot skip

The following patch [1] that disables volume snapshots, fails with
the error: "'NfsDriver' object has no attribute 'create_snapshot'".
This patch adds the missing CONF.volume_feature_enabled.snapshot
skip to that test.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/395887

Change-Id: I5ad578a78d6cfd4186a8230ad472d4a7b92445c9
Closes-Bug: #1640646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/93/396393/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import testtools @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.volume_feature_enabled.clone, 'Cinder volume clones are disabled')

commit_message:
playbooks: bifrost-ironic-install: Fix regexp for pxe_bootfile_name

The previous regexp never matched so a new pxe_bootfile_name was always
appended to the ironic.conf file. We fix this regular expression to
check for any character sequence after the '=' sign.

Change-Id: I9af9704f0ed750aa236c29b08bacd35a82960528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/12/400712/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: regexp='^\#?\s?pxe_bootfile_name\s?=\s?(.*)$'
deleted_lines: regexp='^\#?\s?pxe_bootfile_name\s?=\s?\#?\s?$'

what value server should have. Our tests made it look like it could be a

server id.

Make it explicitly all three, and fix the tests to not test their own

Change-Id: I64361a7a26cfa5137f9e862624fe379219f1cbb1

commit_message:
Allow server to be snapshot to be name, id or dict

In documenting this method, it became clear we weren't telling people
what value server should have. Our tests made it look like it could be a
server name - but in fact it could actually only be a server dict or a
server id.

Make it explicitly all three, and fix the tests to not test their own
mocks. Or, if not actually fix them, at least make their examples not
blatantly wrong.

Change-Id: I64361a7a26cfa5137f9e862624fe379219f1cbb1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/47/400447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param server: Server name or id or dict representing the server to be snapshotted if not isinstance(server, dict): server_obj = self.get_server(server) if not server_obj: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Server {server} could not be found and therefor" " could not be snapshotted.".format(server=server)) server = server_obj
deleted_lines: :param server: Server dict representing the server to be snapshotted

commit_message:
Add documentation on how to use whole disk images

Change-Id: Id883dc6427c72cb3b58e1d25283781f28c085b3e
Depends-On: I9fbac888b3e709212cc6c72153a3ca465101987c
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-full-disk-images
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/75/397075/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ... note:: The images generated by TripleO are single partition ones, but with the help of additional elements and configuration, whole disk images can be generated. To see how to generate whole disk images, see :doc:`http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/baremetal/draft/configure-integration.html#create-and-add-images-to-the-image-service`. In order to use those images on TripleO, please use this command for uploading to Glance:: openstack ovecloud image upload --whole-disk In this case only **overcloud-full.qcow2** image is required, the `overcloud-full.initrd` and `overcloud-full.vmlinuz` images will be used only for the single partition use case. Please note that when using whole disk images, Ironic will rely on partitions and bootloader generated on the supplied image, not applying any extra configuration in the Ironic side.

commit_message:
WIP: shell script to merge roles into extras

Merge all the individual roles into tripleo-quickstart-extras while
retaining history.

Please review and look for:

- missing roles
- changes to role names to make them more clean and meaningful

Change-Id: Ib71a7e452cd571ee75f31a32abc1b1e44f93e522
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/94/396694/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -ex # overcloud ROLES="overcloud-prep-config overcloud-prep-flavors overcloud-prep-images overcloud-prep-network overcloud ssl" # utility ROLES="$ROLES cleanup-nfo collect-logs gate provision-heat image-build reboot" # post deployment ROLES="$ROLES overcloud-upgrade overcloud-scale-nodes tempest validate-ipmi overcloud-validate" # baremetal ROLES="$ROLES baremetal-prep-virthost overcloud-prep-baremetal" git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras pushd tripleo-quickstart-extras for role in $ROLES; do # rename roles if [ "$role" = "overcloud" ]; then newrole=overcloud-deploy elif [ "$role" = "ssl" ]; then newrole=overcloud-ssl elif [ "$role" = "overcloud-prep-baremetal" ]; then newrole=baremetal-prep-overcloud elif [ "$role" = "cleanup-nfo" ]; then newrole=virthost-full-cleanup elif [ "$role" = "tempest" ]; then newrole=validate-tempest elif [ "$role" = "overcloud-validate" ]; then newrole=validate-pingtest else newrole=$role fi git remote add -f $newrole https://github.com/redhat-openstack/ansible-role-tripleo-$role.git git checkout -b $newrole $newrole/master mkdir -p roles/$newrole git rm .gitreview .gitignore setup.cfg setup.py LICENSE git commit -a -m "Cleanup extra files from $newrole" find . -maxdepth 1 \! -path "." \ \! -path "./.git" \ \! -path "./roles" \ \! -path "./playbooks" \ \! -path "./configs" \ -execdir git mv {} roles/$newrole/ \; git commit -a -m "Move role files to roles/$newrole" git checkout master git merge -m "Merge role $newrole" $newrole git remote remove $newrole done popd

commit_message:
Use "glance_api" as the backend name

"glance_api" is used instead of "glance-api" as the backend name in the haproxy
configuration. Ideally, we should not rely on names defined in the user
configuration, but we have no solution for this right now.

Change-Id: I23647af197dcf900c76edf90bb6d8be7d6f03446

commit_message:
Remove reboot task

This task isn't needed for example purposes but it indirectly conflicts
with other task which are cruicial for tests. These tasks create files
in /tmp but the reboot task makes them disappear.

Change-Id: Iff09fb84c04737813455cc7cc75502f14c992e90
Closes-Bug: #1625244

Remove 'ansible' from README directory list

Since ansible moved into kolla-ansible there is no ansible directory in
kolla anymore. Remove its reference from the README.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Clean up docs around local registry

* Remove duplicated info between the 'image-building' and 'multinode'
  guides regarding deploying a local insecure registry.

* Add a helper script to easily start a local registry in a consistent
  way.

* Remove warnings around bugs in older registries, 2.3+ is now the
  default

* Remove references to running the local registry on port 4000, this
  causes confusion as Docker expects port 5000 by default unless
  specified, and registries are not required for all-in-one deployments
  anyhow.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I89f231df09102e3f1d5f21c8a8ca938ea60ae95b

commit_message:
Release docker-py version constraint

The upper constraint of docker-py was limited because there is a
conflicted dependency issue [2]. The issue was fixed in docker-py
1.8.1 [3] so we can release the constraint now.

Note: This patch was proposed [4] in before, but it has been
reverted [5] due to an issue [6]. Now, the issue has been fixed
in docker-py [7], so I re-proposed this patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/304296/
[2] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2870
[3] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1039
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/366948/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/381780/
[6] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/issues/1155
[7] https://github.com/docker/docker-py/pull/1242

Change-Id: Ie233d54d42f09fc22983fe5627d111f0db8d6252

commit_message:
Swap the notification formats in the docs

The default notification format should be the one the user
reads first. Swap the CADF format and the basic one around.

Change-Id: I7adeb94e1233dafead62ee8b2a9d4f2cda8b22db
Related-Bug: 1641660
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/38/399938/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Basic Notifications =================== All basic notifications contain a limited amount of information, specifically, just the resource type, operation, and resource id. The ``payload`` portion of a Basic Notification is a single key-value pair. .. code-block:: javascript { "resource_info": <resource_id> } Where ``<resource_id>`` is the unique identifier assigned to the ``resource_type`` that is undergoing the ``<operation>``. Supported Events ---------------- The following table displays the compatibility between resource types and operations. ======================== ================================= resource type supported operations ======================== ================================= group create, update, delete project create, update, delete role create, update, delete domain create, update, delete user create, update, delete trust create, delete region create, update, delete endpoint create, update, delete service create, update, delete policy create, update, delete ======================== ================================= Note, ``trusts`` are an immutable resource, they do not support ``update`` operations. Example Notification -------------------- This is an example of a notification sent for a newly created user: .. code-block:: javascript { "event_type": "identity.user.created", "message_id": "0156ee79-b35f-4cef-ac37-d4a85f231c69", "payload": { "resource_info": "671da331c47d4e29bb6ea1d270154ec3" }, "priority": "INFO", "publisher_id": "identity.host1234", "timestamp": "2013-08-29 19:03:45.960280" } If the operation fails, the notification won't be sent, and no special error notification will be sent. Information about the error is handled through normal exception paths. By default, messages for the following authentication events are squelched since it is too noisy: ``identity.authenticate.success``, ``identity.authenticate.pending`` and ``identity.authenticate.failed``.

The ``payload`` portion of a Basic Notification is a single key-value pair. .. code-block:: javascript { "resource_info": <resource_id> } Where ``<resource_id>`` is the unique identifier assigned to the ``resource_type`` that is undergoing the ``<operation>``. Supported Events ---------------- The following table displays the compatibility between resource types and operations. ======================== ================================= resource type supported operations ======================== ================================= group create, update, delete project create, update, delete role create, update, delete domain create, update, delete user create, update, delete trust create, delete region create, update, delete endpoint create, update, delete service create, update, delete policy create, update, delete ======================== ================================= Note, ``trusts`` are an immutable resource, they do not support ``update`` operations. Example Notification -------------------- This is an example of a notification sent for a newly created user: .. code-block:: javascript { "event_type": "identity.user.created", "message_id": "0156ee79-b35f-4cef-ac37-d4a85f231c69", "payload": { "resource_info": "671da331c47d4e29bb6ea1d270154ec3" }, "priority": "INFO", "publisher_id": "identity.host1234", "timestamp": "2013-08-29 19:03:45.960280" } If the operation fails, the notification won't be sent, and no special error notification will be sent. Information about the error is handled through normal exception paths.

commit_message:
Add handle for 2 exceptions in force_delete

as force_delete is same to delete action, we need handle
InstanceNotFound and InstanceCellUnknown exception.

Change-Id: I1840f8f4ac1b793fd6348b4d056cb94e1333e596
Related-Bug: 1641523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/397373/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(compute_api.API, 'get') @mock.patch.object(compute_api.API, 'force_delete', side_effect=exception.InstanceNotFound( instance_id='fake_uuid')) def test_force_delete_instance_notfound(self, mock_force_delete, mock_get): req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/servers/fake_uuid/action') ex = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.extension._force_delete, req, 'fake_uuid', '') self.assertIn('Instance fake_uuid is cound not be found', ex.explanation) @mock.patch.object(compute_api.API, 'get') @mock.patch.object(compute_api.API, 'force_delete', side_effect=exception.InstanceUnknownCell( instance_uuid='fake_uuid')) def test_force_delete_instance_cellunknown(self, mock_force_delete, mock_get): req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank('/v2/fake/servers/fake_uuid/action') ex = self.assertRaises(webob.exc.HTTPNotFound, self.extension._force_delete, req, 'fake_uuid', '') self.assertIn('Cell is not known for instance fake_uuid', ex.explanation)

commit_message:
Not using mox stubs in nova.tests.unit.consoleauth

remove stubs with newly introduced stub_out
function also use mock to replace old mox in consoleauth subfolder.

Part of blueprint remove-mox-newton

Change-Id: I9d2843652c2fe5f8790e19c8ea69896e944b83e5

commit_message:
Make oslo.messaging amqp1 driver non-voting

Temporarily mark amqp1 tests non-voting until the post-test-hook
function in oslo.messaging can be fixed.

See:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1643644

Change-Id: I712589ada64a86146633c07c71af8bf70c3b24c5

subject: DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 11:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico/commit/1b6f07d7a3b3bcbc1067a974f1ccb0ded75a2b54', 'message': "DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'

The DevStack plugin uses a PPA for two reasons:

- for the Calico dependencies that we don't build from source and that
  are not available in Ubuntu

- when running against OpenStack Kilo, to pick up Calico-modified Nova
  and Neutron packages.

Please note, in connection with the latter point, that from Liberty
onwards Calico works with vanilla Nova and Neutron - so that point
really is only needed when running with Kilo.

Ignoring the Nova and Neutron packages that are needed for Kilo point,
most of the PPAs at https://launchpad.net/~project-calico have identical
versions of the dependency packages that Calico needs.  However the
'calico-1.4' PPA has these packages for both Trusty and Xenial, whereas
'kilo-testing' only has them for Trusty.  As OpenStack CI jobs now need
to run on Xenial, we need to start using 'calico-1.4'.

It follows that we are temporarily losing the ability of the
networking-calico DevStack plugin to run against OpenStack Kilo (as
'calico-1.4' does not provide the Nova and Neutron packages that are
needed for Kilo).  However it is also the case that we currently have no
OpenStack CI for networking-calico against Kilo.  I hope to add that in
soon - after completing the transition of the master OpenStack CI to
Xenial - and will address the Kilo PPA point then (either by arranging
for the Kilo CI to run on Trusty, or by adding Xenial packages to
'kilo-testing').

Change-Id: I045be86e49f550139945f27d4cd5992079315ff7
"}]
commit_message:
DevStack: Use 'calico-1.4' PPA instead of 'kilo-testing'

The DevStack plugin uses a PPA for two reasons:

- for the Calico dependencies that we don't build from source and that
  are not available in Ubuntu

- when running against OpenStack Kilo, to pick up Calico-modified Nova
  and Neutron packages.

Please note, in connection with the latter point, that from Liberty
onwards Calico works with vanilla Nova and Neutron - so that point
really is only needed when running with Kilo.

Ignoring the Nova and Neutron packages that are needed for Kilo point,
most of the PPAs at https://launchpad.net/~project-calico have identical
versions of the dependency packages that Calico needs.  However the
'calico-1.4' PPA has these packages for both Trusty and Xenial, whereas
'kilo-testing' only has them for Trusty.  As OpenStack CI jobs now need
to run on Xenial, we need to start using 'calico-1.4'.

It follows that we are temporarily losing the ability of the
networking-calico DevStack plugin to run against OpenStack Kilo (as
'calico-1.4' does not provide the Nova and Neutron packages that are
needed for Kilo).  However it is also the case that we currently have no
OpenStack CI for networking-calico against Kilo.  I hope to add that in
soon - after completing the transition of the master OpenStack CI to
Xenial - and will address the Kilo PPA point then (either by arranging
for the Kilo CI to run on Trusty, or by adding Xenial packages to
'kilo-testing').

Change-Id: I045be86e49f550139945f27d4cd5992079315ff7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/96/400696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-add-repository -y ppa:project-calico/calico-1.4
deleted_lines: sudo apt-add-repository -y ppa:project-calico/kilo-testing

commit_message:
Enable CADF notification format by default

The current default notification format is set to ``basic``, the home-brewed
openstack-styled format.  Since all new notifications have adhered to the
CADF format, we should switch to use CADF format by default, which provides
compatibility with the older format.

Also, messages for the following authentication events are squelched due
to their chattiness:

* identity.authenticate.success
* identity.authenticate.pending
* identity.authenticate.failed

Change-Id: I6dd3a52319bd59aa5ef856e6d99b5a1d7c37e371
Closes-Bug: #1641660
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/39/397339/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Changed the default notification from ``basic`` to ``cadf``. Also, by default, opt-out the following authentication events from emitting notification due to their chattiness. ``identity.authenticate.success``, ``identity.authenticate.pending``, and ``identity.authenticate.failed``.

commit_message:
Cleanup service usage

oslo_service Service usage in the engine was slightly wrong: we
inherited from the base class without using its threadgroup, and we also
inherited from it in utility classes that were not real services. This
cleans up those.

Change-Id: I0f902afb2b4fb03c579d071f9b502e3108aa460a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/72/378572/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class EngineListener(object): self._server = None self._server = rpc_messaging.get_rpc_server(self.target, self) self._server.start() def stop(self): if self._server is not None: self._server.stop() self._server.wait()class EngineService(service.ServiceBase): if self.listener: self.listener.stop() def wait(self): pass
deleted_lines: class EngineListener(service.Service): super(EngineListener, self).__init__() super(EngineListener, self).start() server = rpc_messaging.get_rpc_server(self.target, self) server.start()class EngineService(service.Service): super(EngineService, self).__init__() super(EngineService, self).start() super(EngineService, self).stop() super(EngineService, self).reset()

commit_message:
Generate CephClusterFSID for new stacks

This parameter is needed for new deployments using Ceph, but it
should not change across updates/upgrades.

Change-Id: I2ac62d47922f7dc1d37b2da313fd35f08debfab4
Closes-Bug: #1636555
Related-Bug: #1643701

added_lines: import siximport uuid if stack_is_new: parameters['CephClusterFSID'] = six.text_type(uuid.uuid1())

commit_message:
Workaround for LP#1641568

If a server performs a very slow operations with network devices,
libvirt can raise an exception when destroy a domain.
However, domain is actually destroyed.

Make a workaround to continue with other domains.

Related-Bug:#1641568

Change-Id: I0c38dd1977b410723a530724d34fe2ac231cf0b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-devops refs/changes/58/399558/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self.conn.lookupByUUIDString(node.uuid).destroy() except libvirt.libvirtError as e: if e.get_error_code() == libvirt.VIR_ERR_SYSTEM_ERROR: logger.error("Error appeared while destroying the domain {}, " "ignoring".format( self.conn.lookupByUUIDString(node.uuid).name())) return None else: raise
deleted_lines: self.conn.lookupByUUIDString(node.uuid).destroy()

Add essential repo files

within the roles until we fix them.

The documentation of each role is located in the individual role folders, and general usage information is in the [tripleo-quickstart docs](http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tripleo-quickstart/).

commit_message:
Promote Monasca tempest tests on ubuntu-xenial

Tests on mitaka branch are executed with ubuntu-trusty. Newer branches
are tested with ubuntu-xenial.

Change-Id: I5daa4d4acf31e5f119dec5bbf23dec5c053fa9ad

commit_message:
add non-voting functional tests job for networking-odl

As part of extending testing coverage for networking-odl a new job
functional tests job is introduced in Gate.

commit_message:
Add cinder job with zeromq and multibackend

This commit adds experimental Cinder job with both zeromq and
multibackend configured. This is to make sure we won't break this
scenario once it's fixed.

Change-Id: Ic8b7eb52ca00971623ea96f4322c9ea6425b84ea

commit_message:
[sahara] scenario jobs: jobs modifications

1. sahara-tests in branchless repository and scenario
jobs are running only on master of sahara. using xenial for
that.
2. since in Ocata n-net is going to be almost removed, removing
job for that in sahara-tests.
3. moving job for saharaclient to voting state.

Change-Id: I24ba412f3481ce957ea0e48523f5b3dd252daba2

commit_message:
Add processing for old-style roles meta

We shouldn't break backward compatibility for old-style plugins
and release metadata. The idea is to put so-called tag into role
tags if this field doesn't exist, also, tag should inherit role's
'has_primary' property.

Change-Id: I66de62948d01cb265b789460585f943c2dd80ba8
Implements: blueprint role-decomposition
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/39/399639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import six if 'roles_metadata' in d: roles_meta = d['roles_metadata'] tags_meta = d.get('tags_metadata', {}) available_tags = set(tags_meta) for role_name, meta in six.iteritems(roles_meta): role_tags = set(meta.get('tags', [])) missing_tags = role_tags - available_tags if missing_tags: raise errors.InvalidData( "Tags {} are present for role {}, but, absent in " "release tags metadata".format(missing_tags, role_name), log_message=True )

Change-Id: I12d765c38c1cfc7c397fef4497e9f11f260f4517
Needed-By: I8b8ddf2a9cc4d2f18c4b32917630c2a26ee0d713

commit_message:
Set NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS in fwaas devstack plugin

The NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS environment variable needs to be controlled
so that the fwaas or fwaas_v2 extensions can be properly added.  This is
necessary because the tempest tests for v1 and v2 trigger based on what
extensions are loaded.  Without this, NETWORK_API_EXTENSIONS would
default to 'all', and the fwaas_v2 tests would run when fwaas v1 is
loaded and vice versa.

Change-Id: I12d765c38c1cfc7c397fef4497e9f11f260f4517
Needed-By: I8b8ddf2a9cc4d2f18c4b32917630c2a26ee0d713
Needed-By: I9fc39c5adcf136fce520c329f48cbad60cd21861

commit_message:
refactor notification test to work with either format

The _test_notification_operation function only works with the
`basic` notification format.

For the `cadf` format to work, it is necessary to mock the
_create_cadf_payload call.

Change-Id: I982fcead0f6cb89a13057ee5275087d2e32612cc
Related-Bug: #1641660

commit_message:
[arch-design] Update arch content migrated from ops guide

Removed Ops content from arch compute design page
1. Removed logging
2. Removed network

If either of these have merit, they should be re-written to refer to
architecture concepts.

Change-Id: I664eb0aa91216b29b4064f8bbc7d1e28a5216f25
Implements: blueprint arch-guide-restructure
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/10/374410/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <http://www.amd.com/en-us/innovations/software-technologies/server-solution/vir ualization>`_.
deleted_lines: <http://www.amd.com/en-us/innovations/software-technologies/server-solution/virtualization>`_. Logging ~~~~~~~ Logging is described in more detail in `Logging and Monitoring <http://docs.openstack.org/ops-guide/ops-logging-monitoring.html>`_. However, it is an important design consideration to take into account before commencing operations of your cloud. OpenStack produces a great deal of useful logging information, however; but for the information to be useful for operations purposes, you should consider having a central logging server to send logs to, and a log parsing/analysis system (such as logstash). Networking ~~~~~~~~~~ Networking in OpenStack is a complex, multifaceted challenge. See :doc:`design-networking`.

commit_message:
[suse] LBaaS v2 / optional floating ip support

Make use of the Magnum::Optional resources in order to
honor LBaaS v2/floating ip flags when starting a cluster

Change-Id: Ia38126fb9ee8477a90f22db99e36d5bb07492ac6

Make inspection also respect whether iPXE is enabled

Rename ipxe_deploy to ipxe_enabled and make inspection use it.

Change-Id: Ia3e2a5812e8f0e30664c179cfb1baa31127041d9

(cherry picked from commit 90f7f548d6ceaf232090a8a3b4316d8026f5d182)

commit_message:
Refined version of heka-ceilometer in order to manage logs from
- apache: ceilometer-api
- openstack: ceilometer-collector, polling...

Change-Id: Ib3fd0540a276adaf75c1c4d7257db1707dee157d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/02/400702/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: file_match = 'ceilometer/(?P<Service>ceilometer-api.*)\.log\.?(?P<Seq>\d*)$' [openstack_log_decoder] type = "SandboxDecoder" filename = "lua_decoders/os_openstack_log.lua" [ceilometer_logstreamer_input] type = "LogstreamerInput" decoder = "openstack_log_decoder" log_directory = "/var/log/kolla" file_match = '(?P<Service>ceilometer)/(?P<Program>ceilometer-polling|ceilometer-agent-notification|ceilometer-collector)\.log\.?(?P<Seq>\d*)$' priority = ["^Seq"] differentiator = ["Service", "_", "Program"]
deleted_lines: file_match = 'ceilometer/(?P<Service>ceilometer-.*)\.log\.?(?P<Seq>\d*)$'

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/65/400565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # connection issues under proxy, hence uninstalling python-virtualenv package # and installing the latest version using pip. uninstall_package python-virtualenv pip_install -U virtualenv
deleted_lines: # connection issues under proxy so re-install the latest version using # pip. To avoid having pip's virtualenv overwritten by the distro's # package (e.g. due to installing a distro package with a dependency # on python-virtualenv), first install the distro python-virtualenv # to satisfy any dependencies then use pip to overwrite it. install_package python-virtualenv pip_install -U --force-reinstall virtualenv

commit_message:
Add a test for invalid task input expression

* In fact, the bug does not exist. This patch only add a test
  to validate that the behavior in case of invalid task
  input

Change-Id: If5dd3486114bf03ec98c251070e8613d1acee8ce
Closes-Bug: 1527173
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/12/400112/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_invalid_task_input(self): wf_text = """--- version: '2.0' wf: tasks: task1: action: std.noop on-success: task2 task2: action: std.echo message=<% $.non_existing_function_AAA() %> """ wf_service.create_workflows(wf_text) wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow('wf', {}) self.await_workflow_error(wf_ex.id) with db_api.transaction(): wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) tasks = wf_ex.task_executions self.assertEqual(2, len(tasks)) self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task1', state=states.SUCCESS) t2 = self._assert_single_item(tasks, name='task2', state=states.ERROR) self.assertIsNotNone(t2.state_info) self.assertIn('Can not evaluate YAQL expression', t2.state_info) self.assertIsNotNone(wf_ex.state_info) self.assertIn('Can not evaluate YAQL expression', wf_ex.state_info)

commit_message:
fix ci gate

* Build kolla image by using kolla project's code
* bump openstack_release to 4.0.0
* Remove tox deploy related env, it is useless now.

Depends-On: I132ee005bce993cbadf411697817c2e95548dc81
Change-Id: Id899eb39d476b95130fbeb43adf4fd49ef32be32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/01/398501/25 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function build_image { cat > /tmp/clonmap <<EOF clonemap: - name: openstack/kolla dest: kolla EOF /usr/zuul-env/bin/zuul-cloner -m /tmp/clonemap --workspace "$(pwd)" \ --cache-dir /opt/git git://git.openstack.org \ openstack/kolla pip install -r kolla pushd kolla setup_config popd kolla-build -p gate } build_image
deleted_lines: setup_config

commit_message:
Add 'options' to OpenStackCharm class

This changeset adds an 'options' property to the OpenStackCharm
class that is evaluated/added when the class is created.  This
enables the OpenStackCharm derived class to access computed
options as well as the config from the config.yaml.

Addtional changes are to simplify testing (and the need to mock)
by delaying instantiating or evaluating properties/members on
the the class during the __init__() method.  This means that
they are lazily evaluated which also helps with hook performance
if the property is not used during that hook invocation.

Change-Id: If6d103b4f62c95b0fa76562a18e418e0d319e987

The recently created tripleo-quickstart-extras repository will consists
of several pre-existing ansible roles. We want to save history and
attribution by merging their commit history in the new repository.

This requires a temporary push, push merge commit and forge commiter

Change-Id: Ia8736843fc2e5a94842398b0669ecde72c9543ee

commit_message:
Temporary push rights for tripleo-quickstart repos

The recently created tripleo-quickstart-extras repository will consists
of several pre-existing ansible roles. We want to save history and
attribution by merging their commit history in the new repository.

This requires a temporary push, push merge commit and forge commiter
right. These changes will be reverted after pushing the already
prepared history.

Change-Id: Ia8736843fc2e5a94842398b0669ecde72c9543ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/400200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: forgeCommitter = group tripleo-quickstart-core push = group tripleo-quickstart-core pushMerge = group tripleo-quickstart-core

for all jobs.

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need

Closes-Bug: #1640126
"}]
commit_message:
Use mode 'http' in haproxy for ceilometer, neutron, aodh and gnocchi

HAProxy won't pass X-Forwarded-Proto to these services in mode tcp, so we need
to switch it to http in order for it to work and for the services to properly
set the protocol in the links they serve.

Change-Id: Ib10282159fb9269eebe81af23171ec9fb1297cd0
Closes-Bug: #1640126

commit_message:
Controller driver base and pod project driver

This patch adds stevedore-based driver support to the controller and
implements a driver to determine OpenStack project ID used to create
pod ports.

Change-Id: I0002ce1c1f7985955b7f66902dcf5386db212a1a
Partially-Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer not sending logs to heka

ceilometer is not sending logs to heka because no heka-ceilometer.toml is created.
Updated templates files.

Change-Id: I69f3d93377c6c51d22f37ed120800f7489f5a8a0
Closes-Bug: #1642665

commit_message:
Catch NotFound exception when query tenant info

When query tenant info, the instances retrieved can be
deleted at any time. so api layer need catch that exception.

Change-Id: I8a11e28ac5c7526565599008dfe7b5e11fe5adfb
Closes-Bug: 1643444
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/400399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: info['memory_mb'] = instance.flavor.memory_mb info['local_gb'] = (instance.flavor.root_gb + instance.flavor.ephemeral_gb) info['vcpus'] = instance.flavor.vcpus except InstanceNotFound: # sometimes the instance is gone, try to get its flavor # might get InstanceNotFound exception, see bug 1643444 # so, just ignore the instance from the list. continue
deleted_lines: info['memory_mb'] = instance.flavor.memory_mb info['local_gb'] = (instance.flavor.root_gb + instance.flavor.ephemeral_gb) info['vcpus'] = instance.flavor.vcpus

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Remove logging import unused

This patch removes logging import unused in
 midonet/neutron/agent/midonet_driver.py
 midonet/neutron/db/task_db.py
 midonet/neutron/rpc/topology_client.py
 rally-jobs/plugins/network_plugin.py

Change-Id: Ic440226238227ac3a4f68badc2f50aca89b71fd2

commit_message:
Add the installation steps of murano

The document has provided the installation of a virtual
environmenta using "tox".This fix adds the some steps
of murano in the actual environment.

Change-Id: I114631ff7ab623513f7185cfd4f04d1f763d0dee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/12/399412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #. Create the service credentials for murano: openstack user create --password %PASSWORD% murano openstack role add --project admin --user murano admin cd murano sudo pip install -e .#. Clone and install the murano client:: cd ~ git clone https://github.com/openstack/python-muranoclient cd python-muranoclient sudo pip install -e . #. Configure the database for use with murano. murano-db-manage upgrade #. Configure the keystone endpoint:: openstack service create --name=murano \ --description="Application Catalog for OpenStack" \ application-catalog openstack endpoint create --publicurl http://%YOUR_HOST_IP%:8082 \ --adminurl http://%YOUR_HOST_IP%:8082 \ --internalurl http://%YOUR_HOST_IP%:8082 \ --region=RegionOne \ application-catalog #. Start the API service in a new screen:: murano-api --config-file ./etc/murano/murano.conf #. Start the engine service in a new screen:: murano-engine --config-file ./etc/murano/murano.conf #. Murano should now be up and running! You should see a similar output to:: murano env-template-list +----+------+---------+---------+-----------+ | ID | Name | Created | Updated | Is public | +----+------+---------+---------+-----------+ +----+------+---------+---------+-----------+

commit_message:
Remove docbook

From autohelp-wrapper and autohelp.py, as it's no longer used.

Change-Id: I44d5c37c70b8b4fc0b938b6ba0c2fed5a448c265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/65/400265/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " $(basename $0) [ OPTIONS ] update|rst|setup [ project... ]" update|rst|dump|setup) ;;
deleted_lines: echo " $(basename $0) [ OPTIONS ] update|docbook|rst|setup [ project... ]" echo " docbook: Generate the options tables in docbook format" update|docbook|rst|dump|setup) ;; docbook) if [ "$project" = "swift" ]; then $EXTRACT_SWIFT docbook -m $MANUALSREPO -s $SOURCESDIR/swift else $AUTOHELP docbook $project -i $SOURCESDIR/$project/$project \ $extra_flags $AUTOOPT fi ;;

commit_message:
Revert "Add CephClusterFSID to generated passwords"

This reverts commit 49d23e0821ed8662e4b4ef43368251f3efb7fe0a.

Change-Id: I476e09ce1bd0800dfa2f456242deb6e3e000ee17
Closes-Bug: #1643701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/18/400418/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # CephX keys aren't random strings elif name.startswith("Ceph"): passwords[name] = create_cephx_key()
deleted_lines: import uuidimport six elif name.startswith("Ceph"): if name == "CephClusterFSID": # The FSID must be a UUID passwords[name] = six.text_type(uuid.uuid1()) else: # CephX keys aren't random strings passwords[name] = create_cephx_key()

commit_message:
Corrected test environment

Moved what were called unit tests to the functional directory as there is
more work to be done to make them self supporting.
Added sphinx to the test-requirements along with testr deps.
Adjusted the tox.ini to suit.
Added doc source tree with the minimal set of files to allow sphinx
success.

Change-Id: Ic64c2ccd01778bb0d1142d12ca43b2346bdc7aa7

subject: Fix default retries parameters for shell tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-22 09:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/config.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/shell.rb', 'lib/astute/tasks/master_shell.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute/commit/715aae026bab67e99c8e685939687cc6c499c3e3', 'message': 'Fix default retries parameters for shell tasks

Use shell specific parameters shell_retries and shell_interval,
instead of mc_retries and mc_interval which are used for retries
if node was not accesible via MCollective.

Closes-bug: #1641198
Change-Id: I04a4d187ab3aa4cde46b2775766eb88babd46ab7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default retries parameters for shell tasks

Use shell specific parameters shell_retries and shell_interval,
instead of mc_retries and mc_interval which are used for retries
if node was not accesible via MCollective.

Closes-bug: #1641198
Change-Id: I04a4d187ab3aa4cde46b2775766eb88babd46ab7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/19/400619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @task['parameters']['retries'] ||= Astute.config.shell_retries @task['parameters']['interval'] ||= Astute.config.shell_intervalend
deleted_lines: @task['parameters']['retries'] ||= Astute.config.mc_retries @task['parameters']['interval'] ||= Astute.config.mc_retry_intervalend

Fix coverage job gate

Change-Id: I9d4fa6dfdda21b2cfae568cff044b515f3b56705

added_lines: find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete && python setup.py testr --coverage --testr-args="$*"

commit_message:
Refactoring of the override_resources type for the IaC feature

This commit changes override_resources type allowing to
- specify any puppet resource
- pass any number of resources

It also introduces the logic to decide whether override_resources
should create a new resource, if it hasn't been found in the catalog.

The resource overrides as well as additional settings are taken from
Hiera.

This logic essentially allows to create any Puppet resource via
passing the right hash to the Hiera. It replaces/extends the old
'Advanced configuration' feature.

Change-Id: I81099ac41c3e2abdaf6fde3a19161709b7ba4b8c
Blueprint: puppet-resource-override

added_lines: # This Puppet metatype's purpose is to update the parameters of other type in the catalog # with the values from the configuration data structure, or even create the new ones. # # Configuration structure: # # configuration: # nova_config: # DEFAULT/debug # ensure: present # value: true # DEFAULT/verbose # ensure: absent # # file: # test_file: # ensure: present # path: /tmp/test # content: 123 # web_file: # ensure: present # path: /var/www/html/index.html # content: '<html/>' # # service: # apache: # ensure: running # enable: true # require: File[web_file] # # Applying this structure will update the parameters of specified resources to the values in # the configuration structure, and, if the "create" option is set, will create the missing ones. # The affected Puppet types can be filtered using the "types" option where you can list the type # you want to be processed. # newparam(:name) do desc 'The uniq name of this override)resources type. Serves no purpose other then reference.' newparam(:configuration) do desc 'The configuration data structure to work with.' desc 'The default parameters. They will be applied to every resource created or updated.' newparam(:create) do desc 'Should this type try to create the new resources in the configuration data or only update the existing ones?' newparam(:types) do desc 'The list of Puppet types to process. If the list is empty all the types in the configuration data will be processed.' end def createource(type, title, parameters = {}) create = self[:create] || false elsif create new_resources << createource(type, title, parameters)
deleted_lines: newparam(:type) do newparam(:data) do newparam(:create_res) do def create_resource(type, title, parameters = {}) create_res = self[:create_res] || false elsif create_res new_resources << create_resource(type, title, parameters)

commit_message:
Notify if metrics are not defined or not added for hosts

Now Monitoring driver is getting notifier instance to be used
in case of failure get data for a certain metric or failed to find
the metric added on a certain host, the notifier will be used to
notify admins list (notify-list in config file) that something is
wrong with the metrics and need to look at it

Base notification driver changed to support the following methods:

1. notify_status: will be used to notify if node is failed and
   evacuated
2. notify: will be used anywhere in monitoring drivers to notify
administrators if something is wrong.

Change-Id: I12eddf03d1921a04f5fa9a8101a471bea5f9c507

commit_message:
Set timeout for resource which is used to wrap shell tasks.

Slow tasks fail, because default timeout for `exec` resource
is 300 seconds. The patch passes timeout from the task to
puppet wrapper.

Closes-bug: #1641190
Change-Id: I8f7c2120e61144911481c83b0da391e30bbc6f2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/20/400620/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use constraints in all tox targets

Since August[1] the OpenStack infrastructure now supports constraints
in all jobs, so lets use them here.

This shoudl fix issues like [2]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-August/101474.html
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/71/71a4e63a6cf159a4e5e814a609eafaf5b447cf88/release/heat-docs-ubuntu-xenial/4f407d9/console.html#_2016-11-22_03_35_49_864882

Change-Id: If00690adfe9b3a189f6ae061475abe7d5f4f9fed

commit_message:
Use logging.warning instead of logging.warn

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I84308ef2aaec5985c46b05b22397803e54c4d93a

commit_message:
add odl-server service in devstack for networking-odl multinode job

As highlighted by [1] in a multinode networking-odl Gate job
odl-server or odl-neutron parameter has to be set as per [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/26/396526/4/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-odl-multinode-carbon-snapshot-nv/50562f0/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz#_2016-11-12_01_30_11_309
[2] https://github.com/openstack/networking-odl/blob/ac2bd31ed912220ffc29ed32be4dd9c661494e20/devstack/settings#L6

Change-Id: I0fc1b3202397c8431676de47bef466f79c62496b
Co-Authored-By: Waldemar Znoinski <waldemar.znoinski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix interface update

When updating interface attributes
it is necessary to merge data from nailgun
agent with those that are in the database
instead of just updating them.

Change-Id: I5c20f66e8a7cc0c0de9974508de458672b46840e
Closes-Bug: #1627776

added_lines: from nailgun.utils import dict_merge interface_properties = dict_merge( cls.get_default_interface_properties(), interface.interface_properties or {} ) if interface_attrs.get('interface_properties'): interface_properties = dict_merge( interface_properties, ) # update interface_properties in DB only if something was changed if interface.interface_properties != interface_properties: interface.interface_properties = interface_properties
deleted_lines: if interface_attrs.get('interface_properties'): interface.interface_properties = \ elif not interface.interface_properties: interface.interface_properties = \ cls.get_default_interface_properties()

commit_message:
Lockout ignore user list

This patch adds a way for operators to ignore the lockout validation for
specific users, such as service users.

Closes-Bug: #1642348
Change-Id: I9d48578bc6b4f84acbaaa4251b59ffef10d58d8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/71/398571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_lock_out_for_ignored_user(self): # add the user id to the ignore list self.config_fixture.config( group='security_compliance', lockout_ignored_user_ids=[self.user['id']]) # fail authentication repeatedly the max number of times self._fail_auth_repeatedly(self.user['id']) # authenticate with wrong password, account should not be locked self.assertRaises(AssertionError, self.identity_api.authenticate, self.make_request(), user_id=self.user['id'], password=uuid.uuid4().hex) # authenticate with correct password, account should not be locked self.identity_api.authenticate(self.make_request(), user_id=self.user['id'], password=self.password)

commit_message:
devstack: make tempest timeout longer

As tempest test is run serially and we're adding scenario tests,
we're occasionally hitting timeout of 120 mins.
For now as work around, make timeout a bit longer to 180 mins.
In near future(Ocata cycle) after migrating to new ODL
netvirt(vpnservice), this parallel execution should be enabled
and this work around should be removed.

Change-Id: I758de9600e18a817cbd2eeeb71a5e4fbee83090b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/03/400403/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(yamahata): tempest test is run serially at the moment and # we're occasionally hitting timeout of 120 mins. For now as work around, # lengthen timeout a bit. # In near future(Ocata cycle) after migrating to new ODL netvirt(vpnservice), # parallel execution should be enabled and remove this work around. export export BUILD_TIMEOUT=180

commit_message:
Cinder volume update_host support for upgrade-db

This commit adds cinder-manage volume update_host
for graph-based upgrade-db.

Change-Id: Ibe937391ab95a085167ddda6d04c2999bb650ad0
Closes-Bug: 1641070
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/07/400007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash STORE_PATH=$1 SCRIPT=`readlink -f $0` DIR=`dirname ${SCRIPT}` CINDER_HOST=`bash ${DIR}/fetch_puppet_resource_param.sh cinder_config DEFAULT/host value` CINDER_BACKEND=`bash ${DIR}/fetch_puppet_resource_param.sh cinder_config DEFAULT/volume_backend_name value` echo "export CURRENT_HOST=\"${CINDER_HOST}#${CINDER_BACKEND}\"" > ${STORE_PATH}

Correct AllNodesDeploySteps depends_on

This is wrong atm, it should loop to create a list for the depends_on
not multiple depends_on statements.

Note this was first corrected in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330659/
but we need it as a standalone patch that can be backported.

Change-Id: I4d1d6346f2147e573fc0900038f1ad1d782e75ee
Closes-Bug: #1642069

commit_message:
Cinder volume update_host support for upgrade-db

This commit adds cinder-manage volume update_host
for graph-based upgrade-db.

Change-Id: Ibe937391ab95a085167ddda6d04c2999bb650ad0
Closes-Bug: 1641070
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/06/400006/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash STORE_PATH=$1 SCRIPT=`readlink -f $0` DIR=`dirname ${SCRIPT}` CINDER_HOST=`bash ${DIR}/fetch_puppet_resource_param.sh cinder_config DEFAULT/host value` CINDER_BACKEND=`bash ${DIR}/fetch_puppet_resource_param.sh cinder_config DEFAULT/volume_backend_name value` echo "export CURRENT_HOST=\"${CINDER_HOST}#${CINDER_BACKEND}\"" > ${STORE_PATH}

commit_message:
[8.0] Reboot procedure fixed

Added the workaround to avoid the thin pool exhaustion probably caused
by the issue https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/3182

Change-Id: I2edc74189872754383bf9a1f3215490d46e38b27
